segments.text: I feel so sad watching the water just pour out like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman looks so lost in her own world, and it’s kind of heartbreaking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are just trying to have a little fun, but it’s all going to end badly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to be so upset when she finally notices the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way the water is spreading across the floor makes me feel so helpless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children don’t even realize how much trouble they’re in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could do something to help, but I don’t know what.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels so lonely, even though there are three people in it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t stand seeing the water just waste away like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman’s focus on that plate feels so empty and meaningless.
segments.speaker: PAR
